channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: How Putin misjudged the West‚Äôs response to the Ukraine invasion, explained by Timothy Snyder. https://t.co/eUR7TIKGJL
What do you think of Twitter communities?
Have you ever heard of cable TV news interviewer ask a question that they didn‚Äôt already know the answer to?
Russian spies indicted in worldwide hacks of energy industry, including Kansas nuclear plant. https://t.co/AKmd2mBJn9
@Jason @chesaboudin @LondonBreed @DeanPreston @FrancisSuarez good choices. ;-)
@Jason @chesaboudin @LondonBreed @DeanPreston @FrancisSuarez where will your conference be?
After 25 years, Brewster Kahle and the Internet Archive are still working to democratize knowledge. https://t.co/ZN61HUBEJM
Donald Trump sues Hillary Clinton and allies over Russia claims. https://t.co/38GZdZO2zF

Putin must not have known how much power he had. Ukraine is small potatoes. He was the czar of one half of the political system of the US. It was a real possibility his party would control the whole govt again in 2024. A lot of times people don't know how successful they've been.
BlackRock, Vanguard, and UBS Are Blocking Climate Progress. https://t.co/4U7r0hcB4t
BlackRock's Larry Fink, who oversees $10 trillion, says Russia-Ukraine war is ending globalization. https://t.co/bGEq9lzoh9
@josephzitt That's twitter's schtick.

1/6 Yesterday I wrote a piece that asked a philosophical question. This is how it went. The government can't search you without probable cause, that's in the Constitution. But if you invite someone into your house to visit and they go through your private stuff, that's also
2/6 wrong, even though the Constitution says nothing about it.
3/6 In the same way, you have "free speech," even when it's your employer, school, news org or your family or friends trying to control your speech. The Constitution doesn't prohibit them from doing it, so you don't need to make that much-belabored point.
4/6 Being intolerant of other people's opinions is still, as far as I'm concerned, and many other Americans, of all persuasions, wrong. In America you are free to speak, and it's not just the government that's about, no matter what XKCD says.
5/6 If you punish people for expressing their opinions, you are wrong.
6/6 Even so someone will post that stupid XKCD cartoon about showing you the door. That just proves you're an asshole, although you are certainly entitled to your opinion and I will not try to have you fired. Have a nice day. üòÄ

When I signed on Twitter earlier this evening I was offered a chance to create a community, so I did. https://t.co/iMNWVCi91m Not sure how to use this. In the meantime if you read my blog, go ahead and sign up.
